html:
For anybody interested in attending this year’s Bogleheads Conference (October 17-19 in San Antonio), today is the last day for early-bird pricing.

This year, in addition to the Bogleheads regulars such as Bill Bernstein, Christine Benz, Allan Roth, Rick Ferri, and others, you’ll get to hear from experts such as John Rekenthaler, Cameron Huddleston, Paul Merriman, and more. IRA expert Ed Slott will be joining us, and estate planning attorney Jenny Rozelle (whom many attendees listed as their favorite speaker from last year’s conference) will be returning. We’ll also hear from Vanguard CEO Salim Ramji.

For anybody who hasn’t been to one or isn’t aware, the Bogle Center aims to run these conferences “at cost.” And all of the speakers are volunteering their time. The result is that the Bogleheads Conference is an incredible value, as compared to what you are likely to find from other financial conferences.

You can find more information and register here:
https://boglecenter.net/2025conference/

And as always, for everybody who is unable to attend in person, the conference sessions will be made available on the Bogleheads YouTube channel at a later date. (It typically takes a few months to get the videos ready for release.)

Other Recommended Reading

  • The Joneses Aren’t That Happy from Ben Carlson
  • Eyes Forward from Adam Grossman
  • Protecting Elders From Financial Exploitation from Rick Kahler
  • Lessons on Money & Life I Learned From Warren Buffett from Allan Roth
  • Using an Independent Agent for Auto and Home Insurance from Harry Sit
  • After Successful 2025 Tax Season, IRS Budget Cuts Threaten 2026 Filing Season, Taxpayer Advocate Says from Martha Waggoner
  • The Most Volatile Decade from Ben Carlson

Thanks for reading!

"A wonderful book that tells its readers, with simple logical explanations, our Boglehead Philosophy for successful investing." - Taylor Larimore, author of The Bogleheads' Guide to Investing
